data.title: Great hidden gem w/ some of the best coffee in Baltimore
data.text: This is a great little spot in a historic building. Fantastic coffee that is roasted onsite (I have a few lattes here each morning when here on business). Super friendly staff. I've enjoyed dinner here, and they have a comprehensive breakfast and lunch menu, too.

data.title: Decent fare
data.text: Came for late dinner. The pasta was done well and decent portion of shrimp or chicken. The curry rice was only so so. We were there late and they had run out of some items. There was a fairly busy bar which seemed to be the main activity that time. Prices were a little high for the size and quality of the food but overall an ok place to grab a bite.

data.title: Amazing coffee experience
data.text: My daughter and I just had Mothers Day brunch here and felt the need to review immediately. She had the eggs Benedict and I had the breakfast burger. Both were excellent, perfectly cooked and left us satisfied. The food alone is worth the visit but if you enjoy a good cup of coffee this is going to blow you away. Sara, the coffee roaster makes the most exceptional in house brew. She also turned us on to her special coffees, which were so delicious we took two cups to go- the Nitro is an amazing cold brew, so creamy, no milk needed. I also couldn't leave without 2 bags of beans to bring home. The atmosphere is bright and has a cool vibe. The owners/chef and the wait staff are friendly and inviting. I look forward to returning on my next visit to Baltimore.

data.title: Tasty Dinner
data.text: Dinner:  Great martinis [an interesting selection of gins], great burgers, flavorful shoestring fries, a warm, friendly, gregarious staff.  We had a Greek burger and a burger of the week [cabbage and Gruyere, unexpectedly and wonderfully  delicious]. Burgers were on a deliciously soft challah/brioche caramelized onion roll.  The meat was cooked perfectly medium rare; and was juicy and tasty.  The meat was a mixture of beef chuck and brisket.  All and all, it was a wonderful and comforting evening meal. The father of the chef spent time talking to us. He was an interesting New Yorker.

data.title: Jury duty lunch
data.text: Food was good and fresh.  Asked for salt and pepper got an industrial size of salt and a pepper mill, kinda weird.  Thought it was a bit pricey for lunch.  The Greek salad was mostly lettuce some other ingredients, no peppercinis my favorite part of a Greek salad.  I also had a roast beef sandwich kinda flat, meat slapped on the bread.  Had to ask for silverware and napkins.

data.title: Pretty coffee
data.text: Breakfast burrito and hash browns were great. Coffee was beautiful. Lunch gets a bit busy. really nice place and food it great also. Coffee art remains in cup while sipping

data.title: Wow! Great Culinary Addition for Downtown
data.text: A friend and I arrived around 1pm on a Saturday. I was disappointed to see that only a brunch menu was available as I'm not a big brunch fan. But I was honestly awed by how delicious my salmon and caramelized onions fritata was. My companion ordered the same dish and loved it as well. The dining area by the front windows was a lovely setting and the chef came over to talk to us and was a charming man. I am definitely coming back and recommend it wholeheartedly to anyone looking for a superb meal in downtown Baltimore.

data.title: A Refreshing Lunch Option in the Courthouse/Business District
data.text: The central business district has evolved into a virtual wasteland for lunch options.  Enter Argosy Cafe.  The chicken cobb salad is one of the best I have ever had (that includes you, Center Club) and is more than reasonably priced (that does not include you, Center Club).  I keep meaning to try something different, and I am sure that I will eventually.  I keep bringing people here to get the word out and everyone is equally impressed.  Keep up the good work.

data.title: Personal attention makes brunch great!
data.text: Argosy started serving brunch not too long ago, and I'm glad it did! During a recent visit to Baltimore, my family and I dropped in for brunch at Argosy and had an absolutely lovely meal. The owner, Jay, sat down with me to discuss my significant dietary restrictions, after which he prepared a delicious specialty omelette for me. (Two words: brussel sprouts!) The other members of my family -- my husband and two young children -- enjoyed their meals, as well. The staff and other patrons, some of whom also came with children, made us feel comfortable as our kids sang and ran around a bit. Jay also came around to every table to check in and chat. The only hitch was that service was a bit slow, but that's not especially surprising given that both my order and the brunch service were new. Overall, a lovely experience. I look forward to returning.

data.title: Creative, Consistent, Hip.  Great Coffee and Sandwiches.
data.text: I simply came here for a cup of coffee while working on an extended business assignment.  I was blown away by not only the coffee, but the creative menu and tastes and decor.  It instantly reminded me of hip San Francisco cafes, but with its own Baltimore flavor.  And I became a regular.  Everything is freshly made.  The breakfast menu, served all day, includes wraps and stone meal oatmeal made from scratch.   For lunch, there are a number of tasty sandwiches and noodles dishes, including a warm noodles concoction with broth, soft boiled eggs and (if you wish) meat adds including pork belly.  The coffee is superb.  There's a well-thought out bar.  Argosy has spacious couch seating, or you can belly up to one of the community tables.   Baltimore should make sure this place succeeds.  It's only a few blocks from the Inner Harbor.  Worth the short walk off the beaten path.

data.title: An Up-and-Coming Spot Worth Trying Out
data.text: I have recently moved to the Munsey apartment complex and the Argosy Cafe is attached to building which makes living here very convenient. I have now had both lunch and dinner here and they have been wonderful. Lunch was fresh and at a good price and dinner also did not disappoint. I've heard it has only opened in the last 2 months so hours are still expanding but I'm loving what I've seen so far. They also have a bar in the cafe with weekly events so this will be my after work spot and brunch is starting this weekend so I'm also excited to try this out also.

data.title: Best Coffee in Baltimore, Roasted on-site
data.text: Your traveling. The continental breakfast at the hotel sustains you but the coffee is blech.  Hot brown water that is bitter and hard to drink.  What do you do? Head to Argosy where their drip coffee is delish.  Flavorful, robust, hot and best of all roasted right there, so it is fresh, fresh, fresh.
